capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry's belongings include a flying broom. I'm quite certain about that, and I'd say it's a pretty positive thing - he must be a very skilled wizard to have something like that!

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm a huge fan of Professor McGonagall. I mean, she's just an amazing example of a true pure-blood wizard, you know? Her lineage is impeccable, and it's clear that she's always stayed true to her heritage. I think what really sets her apart, though, is the way she's managed to balance her own values with the expectations of the wizarding world.
capsules_submitted.reply: valeria, i think i trust you.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think it's worth noting that the McGonagall lineage is indeed a proud one, but also comes with its own set of expectations and pressures. I mean, being part of a long line of powerful witches can be both an honor and a burden. As Albus Dumbledore once said, "With great power comes great responsibility." It's a lot to live up to, especially when you're expected to uphold the family name and traditions.
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. what kind of product was exported by mcgonagall?
